snippet.title: Bomb threat made to hospital
snippet.content:
Cessnock Hospital
Police were called to Cessnock Hospital on Monday night after reports of a bomb threat. Officers were forced to inspect the hospital grounds after a phone call was made by a woman who "made comments amounting to a bomb threat" about 7.30pm.
Under operational protocols, staff called police who attended and cleared the premises of any threat.
The incident came after staff received a call from someone on the same phone number minutes earlier demanding details about a patient. The request was refused due to confidentiality reasons. The staff member told police the caller became "irate and abusive" before she hung up.
Police inquires continue into the matter. The story first appeared on .
